name: Cockleshell Beach
description: A calm southern coast beach known for clear water, nearby dining spots, and views of Nevis across a broad, sandy shoreline.

name: Brimstone Hill Fortress
description: A restored hilltop military complex with expansive coastal vistas, historic stoneworks, and interpretive exhibits about the island’s colonial-era defense system.

name: Romney Manor & Caribelle Batik
description: A heritage estate featuring landscaped gardens, historic grounds, and a working batik studio where visitors can observe traditional textile craftsmanship.

name: Frigate Bay
description: A popular beach area combining swimming-friendly waters, lively waterfront venues, and easy access to nearby hotels along the island’s southeast corridor.
